snippet: Rabbi Leib Glanz and Menashe Glanz were accused of stealing more than $220,000 over 15 years in housing subsidies for low-income people.
abstract: Brooklyn Rabbi Leib Glanz, a prominent member of the Satmar Hasidic sect, pleads guilty to making false statements in connection with a federal housing fraud scheme and faces up to one year in prison; Glanz and his brother Menashe Glanz are accused of stealing more than $220,000 over 15 years in housing subsidies from the federal Section 8 program, which is intended to assist low-income people.
lead_paragraph: Rabbi Leib Glanz and Menashe Glanz were accused of stealing more than $220,000 over 15 years in housing subsidies for low-income people.

headline.seo: Brooklyn Rabbi and His Brother Plead Guilty in Section 8 Fraud
headline.main: Brooklyn Rabbi and His Brother Plead Guilty in Section 8 Fraud
headline.print_headline: Brooklyn Rabbi Pleads Guilty In a Federal Housing Swindle
